poem:
### Why Rainbows Curve

A child, wide-eyed, wonders  
why rainbows arch the sky,  
a brushstroke in watercolor,  
spanning the tear-dropped air.  
Sunlight kisses droplets,  
curving into colors,  
not for mere prettiness,  
but an artful dance—  
nature's own reply  
to the awed,  
small faces turned upward.
